methods.name: file_download
methods.description: Request to download file from Zephyr file system.

params.name: off
params.description: Offset where to start file access

items.name: off
items.description: The updated file offset following read

items.name: len
items.description: The total file length, only returned when the requested offset is 0.

methods.name: file_upload
methods.description: Request to upload file to Zephyr file system.

params.name: off
params.description: Offset where to start file access

items.name: rc
items.description: Response code for the upload operation

items.name: r
items.description: negative error code if an error occurred, otherwise size of data returned

items.name: id
items.summary: The id number of what is being set

items.name: r
items.summary: Result status of setting the value. Will return 0 if successful, negative if error

methods.name: calibrate_thermistor
methods.summary: Tell BT6xx to run thermistor calibration using provided calibration parameters

params.name: p1
params.description: Ideal ADC counts for 560 Ohm resistor (R1 = 559.4 ohms --> C1 = 4096 * 559.4/(10000 + 559.4) = 217.0)

items.name: ge
items.description: This is applied to all thermistor readings

items.name: oe
items.description: This is applied to all thermistor readings

methods.name: test_led
methods.summary: Turn green LED on, then red on, green off, and finally red off.

params.name: p1
params.description: Duration in milliseconds for each step

items.name: ge
items.description: This is applied to all thermistor readings

items.name: oe
items.description: This is applied to all thermistor readings

methods.name: set_rtc
methods.description: Time in seconds.  Reference is often Jan 1, 1970

methods.name: get_rtc
methods.summary: Get the current RTC value in UTC
methods.description: Time in seconds.  Default reference is Jan 1, 1970

methods.name: load_parameter_file
methods.description: Used in conjunction with file system commands

items.name: f
items.summary: Path to the feedback file containing load error details
items.description: Error codes are 0 = OK, 1 = Numeric under range, 2 = Numeric over range, 3 = Too many characters, 4 = Read Only, 5 = Unknown Parameter, 6 = Invalid Length

methods.name: dump_parameter_file
methods.summary: Dump chosen parameters to a file
methods.description: Used in conjunction with file system commands

items.name: r
items.description: negative error code, length of file in bytes on success

items.name: n
items.description: The absolute path name of the dump file on the file system. Returned only when successful.

methods.name: prepare_log
methods.description: Used in conjunction with file system commands to read logs

items.name: s
items.summary: The size of the log file to read
items.description: the size of the log file

items.name: n
items.description: The absolute path name of the log on the file system

methods.name: factory_reset
methods.summary: This will force a factory reset of the device.

methods.name: prepare_test_log
methods.description: Used in conjunction with file system commands to read logs

params.name: p1
params.description: The timestamp from which to start test log data.

params.name: p3
params.description: The event type to set for test log data.

params.name: p4
params.description: The number of events to add to the test log file.

params.name: p5
params.description: The data type to use for the event, 0 = bool, 1 = U32, 2 = Float.

items.name: r
items.description: negative error code, number of log files to read on success

items.name: s
items.summary: The size of the log file to read
items.description: the size of the log file

items.name: n
items.description: The absolute path name of the log on the file system

items.name: r1
items.description: True if the lock has been setup, false otherwise

items.name: r2
items.description: True if the lock is currently engaged, false otherwise

methods.name: set_lock_code
methods.description: If successful, will update the lock code and the lock will engage when the UART/BLE device disconnects

params.name: p2
params.description: If set to true, will clear the lock entirely until it is manually re-enabled

methods.name: get_unlock_error_code
methods.summary: Check last error code umlock error code (clears last error on read)

items.name: r1
items.description: Error code from last unlock attempt, 0 = no error, 1 = valid code, 2 = invalid code. Reset to 0 on read

schema.name: device parameters list.
schema.description: The following parameters are interfaceable on the device.

x-deviceparameters.name: sensor_name
x-deviceparameters.summary: Sensor Name

x-deviceparameters.name: sensor_location
x-deviceparameters.summary: Sensor Location

x-deviceparameters.name: advertising_interval
x-deviceparameters.summary: Advertising Interval in milliseconds. Must be 4x less than the Duration when the Duration is non-zero.

x-deviceparameters.name: advertising_duration
x-deviceparameters.summary: Advertising duration of an event in milliseconds. Must be 4x greater than the Interval.

x-deviceparameters.name: passkey
x-deviceparameters.summary: Six-Digit Numberic Passkey

x-deviceparameters.name: lock
x-deviceparameters.summary: Lock enabled: false = lock not setup, true = lock setup. See lockStatus for details on if lock is active

x-deviceparameters.name: power_sense_interval
x-deviceparameters.summary: Power Sense interval in seconds

x-deviceparameters.name: temperature_sense_interval
x-deviceparameters.summary: Temperature Sense interval in seconds

x-deviceparameters.name: aggregation_count
x-deviceparameters.summary: Aggregation value used on all the sensor data

x-deviceparameters.name: digital_output_1_state
x-deviceparameters.summary:
false = off
true = on

x-deviceparameters.name: digital_output_2_state
x-deviceparameters.summary:
false = off
true = on

x-deviceparameters.name: firmware_version
x-deviceparameters.summary:
Firmware Version.
Format = Major.Minor.Build

x-deviceparameters.name: reset_reason
x-deviceparameters.summary: For Development

x-deviceparameters.name: bluetooth_address
x-deviceparameters.summary: Bluetooth MAC

x-deviceparameters.name: reset_count
x-deviceparameters.summary: reset Count

x-deviceparameters.name: bootloader_version
x-deviceparameters.summary:
Bootloader Version
Format = Major.Minor

x-deviceparameters.name: up_time
x-deviceparameters.summary: Time in milliseconds since the last reboot

x-deviceparameters.name: active_mode
x-deviceparameters.summary:
false = inactive (shelf mode)
true = active (sample enabled)

x-deviceparameters.name: use_coded_phy
x-deviceparameters.summary:
false = coded PHY not active
true = Coded PHY on

x-deviceparameters.name: network_id
x-deviceparameters.summary: Network Id

x-deviceparameters.name: config_version
x-deviceparameters.summary: Config Version
x-deviceparameters.description: This is used for synchronization between clients (Bluegrass/Phone application).

x-deviceparameters.name: config_type
x-deviceparameters.summary:
0 = Not Configured
1 = Analog
2 = Digital
3 = Temperature
4 = Current
5 = UltraSonic/Pressure
6 = SPI/I2C
x-deviceparameters.description: Writing this will cause other attributes to be set with the correct value.

x-deviceparameters.name: hardware_minor_version
x-deviceparameters.summary: Hardware minor version set during production
x-deviceparameters.x-review: should this just be Hardware Version, there aren't resistors on the board

x-deviceparameters.name: ge
x-deviceparameters.summary: ADC Calibrated Thermistor Gain Error

x-deviceparameters.name: oe
x-deviceparameters.summary: ADC calibrated offset error

x-deviceparameters.name: old_coefficient_a
x-deviceparameters.summary: This is not used

x-deviceparameters.name: old_coefficient_b
x-deviceparameters.summary: This is not used

x-deviceparameters.name: old_coefficient_c
x-deviceparameters.summary: This is not used

x-deviceparameters.name: thermistor_config
x-deviceparameters.summary: Bitmask of Thermistor Inputs.  Bit 0 is thermistor 1.  1 is enabled, 0 is disabled

x-deviceparameters.name: temperature_result_1
x-deviceparameters.summary: Temperature in C

x-deviceparameters.name: temperature_result_2
x-deviceparameters.summary: Temperature in C

x-deviceparameters.name: temperature_result_3
x-deviceparameters.summary: Temperature in C

x-deviceparameters.name: temperature_result_4
x-deviceparameters.summary: Temperature in C

x-deviceparameters.name: temperature_alarms
x-deviceparameters.summary:
Bitmask for all 4 channels and each alarm.
 dddddcccccbbbbbaaaaa
 1 = indicates active, 0 = no alarm triggered
x-deviceparameters.description:
PORT1_H1_BITMASK = 1 
PORT1_H2_BITMASK = 2 
PORT1_L1_BITMASK = 4 
PORT1_L2_BITMASK = 8 
PORT1_DELTA_BITMASK = 16 

PORT2_H1_BITMASK = 32 
PORT2_H2_BITMASK = 64 
PORT2_L1_BITMASK = 128 
PORT2_L2_BITMASK = 256 
PORT2_DELTA_BITMASK = 512 

PORT3_H1_BITMASK = 1024 
PORT3_H2_BITMASK = 2048 
PORT3_L1_BITMASK = 4096 
PORT3_L2_BITMASK = 8192 
PORT3_DELTA_BITMASK = 16384 

PORT4_H1_BITMASK = 32768 
PORT4_H2_BITMASK = 65536 
PORT4_L1_BITMASK = 131072 
 PORT4_L2_BITMASK = 262144 
PORT4_DELTA_BITMASK = 524288

x-deviceparameters.name: power_voltage_mv
x-deviceparameters.summary: Input power voltage in millivolts
x-deviceparameters.description: Not a float to match previous system

x-deviceparameters.name: digital_input
x-deviceparameters.summary: Bit 0 is digital input 1, Bit 1 is digital input 2

x-deviceparameters.name: digital_alarms
x-deviceparameters.summary: Bitmask of alarms for Digital Inputs 1 and 2; Alarm is set when 1

x-deviceparameters.name: digital_input_1_config
x-deviceparameters.summary:
Bit 7 : Enable/Disable; Bits 1:0 Alarm Enumeration:
 0 = None
 1 = falling edge
 2 = rising edge
 3 = both

x-deviceparameters.name: digital_input_2_config
x-deviceparameters.summary:
Bit 7 : Enable/Disable; Bits 1:0 Alarm Enumeration:
 0 = None
 1 = falling edge
 2 = rising edge
 3 = both

Bitmask for all 4 channels and each alarm.
 dddddcccccbbbbbaaaaa

x-deviceparameters.name: analog_input_1_type
x-deviceparameters.summary: Analog Input Channel 1 configuration
x-deviceparameters.description:
Enumeration:
 0 = Unused
 1 = Voltage (0V - 10V DC)
 2 = Current (4mA - 20mA)
 3 = Pressure
 4 = Ultrasonic
 5 = ACCurrent20A
 6 = ACCurrent150A
 7 = ACCurrent500A
If changing a pressure sensor port, then any active pressure sensor ports must be first set to 0.

schema.x-review: can we link an enumeration to these?

x-deviceparameters.summary: Analog Input Channel 2 configuration

x-deviceparameters.name: boot_phy
x-deviceparameters.summary: The PHY to enable for 30s at bootup

x-deviceparameters.name: mobile_app_disconnect
x-deviceparameters.summary: This is used when the mobile app wants to disconnect, causing the BT6 to confirm the disconnect before forcing it
x-deviceparameters.description: 0 = do not disconnect, 1 = start disconnect after 2 seconds

x-deviceparameters.name: attr_save_error_code
x-deviceparameters.summary: Result code from deferred settings saving

x-deviceparameters.name: settings_passcode_status
x-deviceparameters.summary: Will return the status of current settings passcode entered

x-deviceparameters.name: recover_settings_count
x-deviceparameters.summary: Used for recovering settings
x-deviceparameters.description: A rolling count of number of times the module has been recovered

x-deviceparameters.name: block_downgrades
x-deviceparameters.summary: Allows FOTA downgrading of older firmwares to be disallowed
x-deviceparameters.description: Will disallow receiving older firmware files via FOTA when set to 1

x-deviceparameters.name: security_request
x-deviceparameters.summary: Request sensor sends a Bluetooth security request to upgrade connection security
x-deviceparameters.description: Write 1 to have sensor send a security request for pairing

x-deviceparameters.name: security_level
x-deviceparameters.summary: Current Bluetooth security level as seen by the sensor
x-deviceparameters.description: -1 indicates error, otherwise value indicates level as per bt_security_t

x-deviceparameters.name: lock_status
x-deviceparameters.summary: Lock status, 0 = lock not setup, 1 = lock setup and engaged, 2 = lock setup and disengaged
